Description: Beaker and cover; porcelain; painted in colours; in the sides two oval openings, one with a silver-gilt medallion and one with a lens through which the back of the medallion can be seen; on the cup are two hermits, one in a pilgrim's dress and staff, crossing a bridge, the other seated and reading a book, as is also a third hermit on the cover; in the background landscape with buildings, rocks etc.; on the cover two coats of arms accollés, being repetitions of the same and painted in red, viz - quart. 1 and 4, a ram's head, from which issue three feathers; 2 and 3, a half spread eagle; Rechenberg of Silesia; on the top a gilt-metal ornament, a crowned female ending in two fishes tails, one of which she holds in each hand, as on Nürnberg objects; the medallion has on one side an archiepiscopal saint supported in clouds by angels, inscription which is also painted around the glass opening; reverse, three saints, one seated with book with rays round his head, St Mary of Egypt(?) standing, and a seated male saint with rosary; inscription, which is repeated round it on the porcelain; no marks; fake.
Bibliographic references: Franks 1896 / Catalogue of a Collection of Continental Porcelain (262)
Associated names: Named in inscription: St Thomas of Villanueva, Archbishop of Valencia
Representation of: St Mary of Egypt (?)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
